definition: by coincidence/it so happened that/fortunately/against expectation
to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations

sentences.english: Just as I was busiest, he must come bothering me with some questions.
sentences.chinese: 正在我最忙的时候，偏巧他来问我一些问题来烦我。

sentences.english: As luck would have it, he was away that day.
She chanced to speak fluent Spanish.
sentences.chinese: 她偏巧很会说西班牙语。

sentences.english: We were looking for her when she turned up.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在找她，偏巧她来了。

sentences.english: Unluckily is in at this moment, mo Di appears in her life again.
sentences.chinese: 偏巧在这时，莫笛又一次出现在她的生活中。

sentences.english: As it happened, Fortune stood our friend.
sentences.chinese: 偏巧命运帮助了我们的朋友。

sentences.english: It happened that he was not there that day.
It happened / chanced that she spoke fluent Swahili.
sentences.chinese: 偏巧她很会说斯瓦希里语。

definition: just by chance/to happen to (just at the right time)/opportune
too bad/unfortunately/as luck would have it
who would have thought that/who would have expected that
to expect/to presume/to think (sth is likely)
to have no alternative/to be helpless
who would have thought that/who would have expected that
